Supersedeas.definition: a common-law writ commanding a stay of legal proceedings that is issued under various conditions and esp. to stay an officer from proceeding under another writ 2
Supersedeas.origin: [Medieval Latin, you should desist (word used in the writ)]

1.definition: a common-law writ commanding a stay of legal proceedings that is issued under various conditions and esp. to stay an officer from proceeding under another writ

2.definition: an order suspending the proceedings of an inferior court and esp. the enforcement of a judgment until reviewed on appeal
